page.title: 14HOMES IN HORLEY.
page.content: Horley has a mixed selection of houses.Large Victorian and Edwardian detached and some small terraced.In the 50's and 60's some areas were developed with brick built bungalows and three bedroomed houses.Extensive housing developments are again taking place. Croudace are building 44 brick houses and Wates 500 mixed brick and timber framed houses. These new homes have 8 rooms, 3o'x 30' gardens, garages, double glazing and are fully insulated. Most popular is the three bedroomed house.Many occupiers work at Gatwick or commute to London. Wates homes are built to look modern inside and old fashioned outside. Many local people have been employed in the construction of these homes. Machines are hired, timber comes from Scandanavia and N.America and bricks from different parts of the country.
